intro: Euphrasia subpetiolaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Euphrasia subpetiolaris is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
